title: China's Hikvision resolutely opposes U.S. blacklisting: state media
text:
People visit a Hikvision booth at a security exhibition in Shanghai, China May 24, 2019. REUTERS/Aly Song/Files

BEIJING (Reuters) - Chinese state media said on Tuesday video surveillance firm Hikvision (002415.SZ) resolutely opposes the U.S. move to blacklist the firm, saying the decision has no basis in fact. The U.S. Commerce Department on Monday placed 28 Chinese public security bureaus and companies - including Hikvision - on a U.S. trade blacklist over Beijing’s treatment of Uighur Muslims and other minorities.
